page.title: 06Craigie Clips- Part 2
page.content: The{Craigie}area has lost its vast selection of shops due to more people buying from supermarkets and using cars to go into the town. The{main area of{shops}is beside the railway bridge at the{"Lollipop Clock".}The main source of employment is not now the railway. As this suburb has grown in size the residents'{jobs}have become more diverse.Most work in{Perth but some{commute}to{Dundee,Glasgow}and {Edinburgh}as the{road}and{rail}links are good. There are good facilities for old folk who cannot easily get to town as there are two hairdressers, grocers, post office, two butchers, a Launder- ette and a newsagent. Local{businesses include a plumber, house decorator and joiner. The two{churches}run clubs catering for the interests of young and old.
